msItem.title: A collection of Anaphoras and other Orders of Service
An Exposition of the Syriac Liturgy by Jacob of Edessa
msItem.quote: ܠܟܠܗ̣ ܥܡܐ̣. ܐܝܟ ܕܠܣܗܕܘܬܐ. ܘܟܕ ܗܟܢܐ ܥ̇ܒܕ ܡܚܘܐ ܠܗܘܢ̇ ܢܩܥܐ ܥܡܐ ܬܘܕܝܬܐ ܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ. ܘܢܩܕܫܘܢ ܦܘܡ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܘܢܐܡܪܘܢ̇ ܏ܚܕ ܏ܐܒܐ ܏ܩܕܝܫܐ ܏ܚܕ ܏ܒܪܐ ܏ܩܕܝܫܐ ܏ܚܕ ܏ܪܘܚܐ ܏ܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܗܟܢܐ ܢܫܬܘܘܢ ܠܢܣܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܪ̈ܐܙܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ܀ ܘܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܢܣܝܒܘܬܐ܆ ܦܩ̇ܕ ܕܬܗܘܐ ܡܘܕܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܩܘܒܠܛܝܒܘܬܐ. ܚܠܦ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܢܐܙܠܘܢ ܒܫܠܡܐ܀
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܩܘܪܒܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܘܪܗܝ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ

note.bibl: See Assemani, Bibl. Orient., t. i., p. 479 foll.

msItem.note: The text, however, differs considerably from that edited by Assemani, as the passage quoted above (fol. 1 a, lines 4—13), compared with Assemani, p. 483, lines 19—22, suffices to show.

The Order of the Consecration of Water on the Epiphany
Another Order of the Consecration of Water, drawn up by Jacob of Edessa

msItem.title: A Collection of Sedras and Prayers for the whole year
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܕܝܢ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܠܡܟܬܒ [ܣܕܪ̈ܐ] ܘܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܛ̈ܟܣܐ ܘܥ̈ܐܕܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ

msItem.title: The Order of the Washing of Feet

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 93 leaves, many of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 6, 13, 14, 22—24, 27, 28, 50, 56, 58, 65, 66, 74, 82, 86—88 and 90—93. The quires, probably 19 or 20 in number, are signed with letters. Leaves are wanting at the beginning and end, as well as in various other places. There are from 26 to 36 lines in each page. Nearly the whole of this volume is palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of at least three older manuscripts (see Add. 14,496, lower text 1 , Add. 14,496, lower text 2 , and Add. 14,496, lower text 3 ).

collation.p: The quires, probably 19 or 20 in number, are signed with letters.

item.p: Many of the leaves are much stained and torn, especially foll.1,6,13, 14, 22—24, 27, 28, 50, 56, 58, 65, 66, 74, 82, 86—88 and 90—93.
Leaves are wanting at the beginning and end, as well as in various other places.
Nearly the whole of this volume is palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of at least three older manuscripts.

layout.p: There are from 26 to 36 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: This volume, which is palimpsest throughout, is written in a good, regular hand of about the xth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The Books of Joshua and Judges, according to the Peshitta version; A lesson. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 7 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.title: The Books of Joshua and Judges, according to the Peshitta version

item.p: Nearly the whole of this volume is palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of at least three older manuscripts, of which this is the first. See, for example, foll. 5, 7—10, 12, 16, 17, 27, 28, 75, 76, 83, etc.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good Estrangela of the vith or viith cent

msItem.title: Uncertain Contents
msItem.note: The contents cannot be stated with certainty, though rubrics are still partially legible on foll. 69 b and 70 a.

item.p: Nearly the whole of this volume is palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of at least three older manuscripts, of which this is the second. See, for example, foll. 42, 43, 69 and 70.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a fine Estrangela of the vith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Severus. The second part of the treatise of Severus against Joannes Grammaticus of Caesarea. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.title: The second part of the treatise of Severus against Joannes Grammaticus of Caesarea

item.p: Nearly the whole of this volume is palimpsest, the scribe having made use of parts of at least three older manuscripts, of which this is the third. The greater portion of the book appears to have belonged to this manuscript.

handDesc.handNote: A manuscript of the viith cent., written in a small, neat Estrangela.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
